description.narrative: Our Voices Our Futures (OVOF) partners bring extensive experience of lobbying and advocacy at multiple levels to a range of issues connected to gender, sexuality and digital rights. OVOF partners ensure that ground-level evidence and lived realities of structurally silenced women feed directly into lobbying and advocacyat every level and international-level advocacy is translated back into community-level work in the six countries. More international and national-level law and policymakers need to acknowledge and address the issue of growing authoritarianism (and its impact on civic space, democracy and the lives of structurally silenced women) and the increasing influence of anti-gender and anti-rights actors within international and national policy and legal spaces. Key Dutch actors will be mobilised to collaborate with and support Women Human Rights Defenders, LBT activists and sex workers’ rights movements by creating and opening spaces for their participation in international processes such as the Commission on the Status of Women and the Human Rights Council so that their voices will be heard.

title.narrative: 1.3: National and international bodies and decision-makers support laws, policies and regulations supporting and promoting the inclusion and rights of SSW
Number of national legal and policy processes that reflect perspectives of SSW (e.g., law, governmental policy, private sector policy, international agreements)

UHAI grantee partners have just started implementation in Q1 and Q2 2022

title.narrative: Number of direct advocacy initiatives of the OVOF consortium.

comment.narrative: Through UHAI SSWs in Kenya and Uganda participated in CSW65 panel discussion and their lived realities featured WHRDs impact stories for 16 Days of Activism in 2021

title.narrative: Number of UN resolutions (such as UNHRC/UPR) influenced, developed and/or adopted that reinforce the exercise of SSW rights offline and online by states and private sector actors.

title.narrative: 2.4: State shows greater awareness, commitment and accountability towards its duty to protect and uphold the rights of SSW to physical public space.

Trends and substantive progress in state responses, attempts, and new initiatives (public statements, laws, polices, etc.) that demonstrate strengthened state accountability to uphold the rights of and to consult with SSW to public space. (THAT CAN BE ATTRIBUTED TO OVOF WORK)

comment.narrative: 1 instance where demonstrating positive trends and substantive progress in State responses, attempts, and new initiatives (public statements, laws, polices, etc.) that demonstrate strengthened state accountability to uphold the rights of and to consult with SSW to public space.
No results attributable to OVOF Programme because UHAI grantees have just begun implementation of activities in Q1 and Q2 2022

title.narrative: 1.1: Inclusive feminist movements, with the Dutch MFA and embassies build collective pressure.

Number of times Dutch MoFA and/or embassy together with feminist movements jointly advocate for (or against harmful) laws, policies and strategies for sex-workers’ rights, LBT persons’ rights and WHRD’s rights with national-level leaders.

comment.narrative: Number of times Dutch MoFA and/or embassy in Kenya and/or Uganda together with feminist movements jointly advocate for (or against harmful) laws, policies and strategies for sex-workers’ rights, LBT persons’ rights and WHRD’s rights with national-level leaders.
in 2021 UHAI did not participate in the annual Roundtable meeting with Dutch MoFA in Kenya, due to the COVID19 Pandemic restrictions on Convening.
